title: The Lullaby Vote
outcome: A lullaby from Halden’s private archive begins autocasting citywide, unlocking hidden BCI features and giving select citizens access to key system controls. The song’s cryptic patterns invite districts to decode ethical dilemmas, turning BCI restoration into a citywide referendum. Districts must choose between restoring the BCI as it was—flawed but familiar—or embracing a radical, transparent but uncertain alternative—effectively forcing a citywide vote between safety and unknown freedom.

events.description: Halden’s recorded lullaby automatically broadcasts every evening citywide. Hidden system prompts appear, inviting residents to decode new ethical challenges embedded in the music.
Decoded patterns allow districts select administrative power over BCI features. Debates flare: should the system be restored in its old form or rebuilt transparently with collective safeguards?
District assemblies gather outdoors, debating the risks and freedoms of each choice. Memories of Halden’s ambiguous motives fuel argument and reflection.

A citywide referendum is held: citizens must choose between restoring the old BCI, with reforms, or launching a fully open and auditable civic system—deciding whether to favor safety or leap into a new social experiment.
